summary: Adds four female followers to Skyrim. Based on Lovergirl Race.
descriptionHtml:
[size=1][center]Weary and wet through Whiterun Hold,
Clouds gray, yet yielding to the sun.
"Dangerous place" they said to me;
I would believe when dusk has come.

And so they came, fair maidens all
With blessed lips and playful voice.
I'd never felt so hesitant;
Approach or hide - yet just one choice.

Alas, five highwaymen appear
To ease my mind of choices made.
This sight was not as pleasant, though,
As one fair maiden drew her blade.

And so they slayed, fearsome girls all
With magic, blades, and bosoms too.
When all was done, one asked of me,
"Those thoughts of lust afflicting you?"

My lips held shut to not offend,
Yet hers transformed into a smile.
Lifting her shirt, bare breasts in view -
My eyes went wide through this tough trial.

The highwaymen were stripped of gold
As stars appeared with setting sun.
The girl had winked and waved goodbye;
She said to find them at Whiterun.

Some say that lust may be a sin.
How I wish to partake again.
- [i]Yngvar the Singer[/i][/center][/size]

[color=#FFDAB9][b]Description:[/b][/color] Loversgirls adds four female followers to Skyrim. The followers were created using my custom race mod, [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29766]Lovergirl Race[/url].


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Followers:[/b][/color]
Violet the Violent - A two-handed katana-wielding beauty.
Scarlet the Wildfire - A fiery spellsword using fire magic in one hand and a dagger in the other.
Nina the Frozen Heart - An icy spellsword using ice magic in one hand and a sword in the other.
Charlotte the Duelist - A duel-wielding beauty.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Requirements:[/b][/color] This mod requires that you have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29766]Lovergirl Race[/url] installed, which requires Skyrim v1.8.151+.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Installation:[/b][/color] Download the relevant Follower Pack and extract its contents to your Data folder. Activate RaceCompatibility.esm, Lovergirl Race.esp, and Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp in your mod manager. Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp must be placed below Lovergirl Race.esp in your load order.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Customization:[/b][/color]
Changing the followers' outfits to vanilla in-game ones can be done using [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12933]Extensible Followers Framework[/url] or [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14037]Ultimate Follower Overhaul[/url]. I personally use the former. Please note that changing outfits this way will result in your followers losing their default outfits permanently in your current save. Weapons can be changed by merely trading the followers. If the weapon you're trading has better damage, then the follower will likely use it instead.

You can customize the followers with different face and body meshes/textures by overwriting the files in meshesBSnakeLovergirlsCBBE or UNP and texturesBSnakeLovergirlsCBBE or UNP. Make sure to overwrite existing files using the same file name, else your new assets won't be recognized by the mod. You must edit your new meshes in NifSkope to point to the textures in texturesBSnakeLovergirlsCBBE or UNP, else the followers will likely use your default female textures. Charlotte, Nina, and Scarlet use CBBE, while Violet uses UNP.

Do not change the femalehead.nif in meshesBSnakeLovergirlsCBBE or UNP or the tri files in meshesBSnakeLovergirlsfaceparts, else the followers may not look as intended. The followers use your skeleton_female.nif in meshesactorscharactercharacter assets female in hopes of providing BBP support.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Editing Followers in the CK:[/b][/color]
If you wish to edit the follower's face, add headparts like scars, adjust their stats, give them specific equipment, etc., then you'll need to install Wryebash.

After installing Wryebash, move Lovergirl Race.esp to the very top of the esp files list (or the very bottom of the esm files list - same thing). Right-click Lovergirl Race.esp and click "Esmify Self". Then exit Wryebash completely and open Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp in the CK. Make your changes and then start up Wryebash again. Right-click Lovergirl Race.esp and click "Espify Self". Be sure to do this before starting up the game. If you save in-game and forget to "espify" Lovergirl Race.esp, your save file will become corrupt.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Compatibility:[/b][/color] This mod relies upon Lovergirl Race, so it is incompatible with Enhanced Character Edit. You must deactivate EnhancedCharacterEdit.esp in your mod manager or delete it altogether. Mods that make large changes to, or replace, the Drunken Huntsman might be incompatible.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]Uninstallation:[/b][/color] Dismiss the relevant followers, exit the Drunken Huntsman if you're currently inside it, and then save your game. Delete the Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp file and the Lovergirls folder in DatameshesBSnake and DatatexturesBSnake. Delete the folders called "Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp" in DatameshesactorscharacterFaceGenDataFaceGeom and DatatexturesactorscharacterFaceGenDataFaceTint.


[color=#FFDAB9][b]F.A.Q.:[/b][/color]
Q: I don't see any followers in the Drunken Huntsman.
A: If you used "coc whiterundrunkenhuntsman", simply exit the tavern and enter it normally. Make sure Lovergirl Follower Pack.esp is placed below Lovergirl Race.esp in your load order.

Q: I use UFO and I can't get X NPC to follow me.
A: Move the UFO.esp files below Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp in your load order.

Q: I can't seem to recruit X from a different follower mod with this mod activated.
A: Try moving Lovergirls Follower Pack.esp above/below your other followers' esp files in your load order.

Q: Nina, Scarlet, and/or other NPCs have a constant swirly, blue effect surrounding them.
A: If you have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/60]Enhanced Blood Textures[/url] or the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22745]Footprints[/url] mod installed, update them to their latest versions.

[color=#FFDAB9][b]Thanks and Credits:[/b][/color]
Thank you so much to the following authors for granting me express or free-to-use permissions to use their assets:

RAN46, tktk
A&K Team
Apachii
cazy, zzjay
PeggyZone, LaughingVampire, zzjay
caliente
dimon99
LogRaam
Gizmodian, Xenius
FavoredSoul
jmenaru
calyps
Zonzai, Telthalion
Toad

Thank you to En Masse Entertainment for explaining to me their terms of use concerning modding. Nexus Moderators: Please contact me if you wish to see screenshots of my conversation with EME Support. A Nexus administrator has been briefed with the details already.

Thank you to all of the beta testers for their feedback. You guys are awesome.

Special thanks to Carry0830 for providing the inspiration, hints, and fun that was had in trying to recreate his player character, Silmeria.
author: BSnake

files.name: Lovergirls Follower Pack Dawnguard v1_0_1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed Violet's skill weight from One-handed to Two-handed. You must dismiss her and recruit her again to apply the changes.
Fixed texture paths in the CBBE femalebody meshes to point to the correct directory.

files.name: Lovergirls Follower Pack v1_0_1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed Violet's skill weight from One-handed to Two-handed. You must dismiss her and recruit her again to apply the changes.
Fixed texture paths in the CBBE femalebody meshes to point to the correct directory.

files.name: Lovergirls Follower Pack Dawnguard v1_0_2
files.changelogHtml:
Removed Atronach perk from Nina and Scarlet. This should prevent certain mods from constantly triggering the swirly magic effect on them.
Nina, Scarlet, and Violet's weapons are now flagged as Playable, letting you manually replace them through their inventories.

files.name: Lovergirls Follower Pack v1_0_2
files.changelogHtml:
Removed Atronach perk from Nina and Scarlet. This should prevent certain mods from constantly triggering the swirly magic effect on them.
Nina, Scarlet, and Violet's weapons are now flagged as Playable, letting you manually replace them through their inventories.
